Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: solotravellerBedford
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, I liked the hotel. The receptionist greeted me warmly and complimented me on my spoken Italian. My single room was on the first floor of the main building. It was comfortable with a scrupulously clean en-suite shower room, and a bonus was that it had an outside patio with comfortable seating. Many reviewers have commented on the breakfast offering. I thought it was perfectly adequate with a very good range of foods on offer from cereals to cold meats and cheese, fresh fruit, yoghurts etc. The coffee was very good. The only downside was that the scrambled eggs were invariably cold - I suspect that the food warmer was faulty. I ate in the hotelâ€™s restaurant every evening as I found it to be excellent quality and value for money on the first evening. The food was delicious and the house wine was very good indeed. What better after a long day out in Venice? The hotelâ€™s location on the Lido is very pleasant with nice views over the lagoon. It is about ten minutes walk from the Vaparetto (water bus) station, and if you are too tired to walk there is a bus about every 20 minutes which stops outside the hotel. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful throughout, especially the head waiter (Angelo) who really looked after me â€“ he even went to the trouble of reserving a table for me on an evening where the restaurant was heavily booked. I would definitely stay here again â€“ and probably will.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: top89
Reviews.Content: On arriving at this lovely quiet hotel on the Lido was recieved in reception very politely. Lovely room 304..Quiet..Big double bed great bathroom..The breakfast was very good, one of the best i have had in ITALY . lots to choose from, Clean beautiful restaurant,,in the evening,,Good food The head waiter was very proffesional ANGELO was his name.. Lovely gardens with outside cocktail bar...30 meters across the road was the sea. all staff were very service minded..Michele.....Umberto. and the girls at breakfast Was impressed how quiet it was a lovely residential area <<<<Cant wait to come back. WORLD TRAVELLER. Terence Dollman Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Reza_RR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the private part of the beach and not near to the center of Lido. However the city is very small and you can walk or take a bus. Breakfast is good (not very good but ok) and you take it in a very beautiful garden. Staff are mixed some of them are very friendly some not. First day of arrival we face an unfriendly staff and we need to wait for 2 hour to check our reservation problem. There are ants in the room and when I argued they answered this is normal because of the garden !!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with No Soul”
Reviews.Author: Genghis17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very disappointing, and a shame for Best Western chain. Its an old villa looking nice outside but management has no soul inside. I came to Venice happy and left with a frown...from this soul-less place. Why? I hurt my leg while in this hotel, and had to be sent to emergency hospital in the night. I returned to hotel past midnite--the next day, could not walk to Breakfast room downstairs. I requested Reception to kindly have someone bring my breakfast from breakfast buffet which is paid with my room charged---since I could not walk--it was not a room service order--but just a humble request for delivering my food from breakfast buffet. When I checked out--they charged me additional for the breakfast--with additional service charge for delivery to my room-- I asked why--as I had breakfast included in my room charge, and I did not order room service--I would not have mind paying for the delivery of my breakfast which has been paid with my room charge---so why charge more? Besides I only had coffee n bread, cereals and egg; while in the breakfast buffet, there are also fruits and ham, croissant and cakes, and juices, etc which they did not bring me. And more importantly---it was a special request from someone who could not walk--that day! (as I was just in hospital the night before). The Manager who I thought would have been more sympathetic and kind-- and out of goodwill can just waive the additional charge--- of only 12 euros--because breakfast has been paid with room and due of my medical condition--it was exceptional request---to deliver but Manager and Reception man were very rude, chauvinistic and added--if they do this service to everyone for free-they would be bankrupt! Then Reception man added another 3 euros for service making the extra charge 15 euros! Its such a small amount--and I told them I will not get poor by paying it--but it was the principle---humanity, consideration--and double charging. Obviously--this hotel has no soul--and no skills in public relations. They did not want to listen to me--even when I said it was not a normal situation--and was just because I was sick and unable to walk down the buffet breakfast table... They were only after gaining additional 15 euros! My breakfast was included in my room charge--why should they double charge me? So I ended up paying additional 15 euros--a small amount----which they gain but losing me and many others who can sympathize that a Management soul is also important in hotel business! I stayed in this hotel from Oct 26-30, 2011 in Room 205 then 203.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss”
Reviews.Author: Hexthorpe
Reviews.Content: I We stayed at this hotel while on a tour wth Trafalgar. Our room was alright but either the air conditioning didn't work or wasn't turned on. When I complained someone came to the room, fidddled with the thermostat's knobs, said the AC is now working and left. It was no different to before his visit. I understand some hotels don't turn the A.C. on until June 1st. We stayed there at the end of May. Our room although small, was clean and overlooked the garden. A fellow and his wife with whom we were travelling had a room that previously, in their opinion must have been the attic. It had no window except a sky light and was up 32 stairs and no elevator. These same people also said when they asked for a hand with their luggage and were refused help. Other people on the tour complainde of what they felt was a condesending attitude among the staff. I never experienced it whom ever I spoke with was most helpful. A great plus for me is the hotel has bicycles free of charge for the use of guests. My wife and I took bikes and went for a very enjoyable bike ride around the Lido. The hotel is located within easy walking distance of the water taxis and good restaurants. I would stay there again but I would want to know the AC was on and where my room was going to situated.

Reviews.Title: “great quiet location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrismpound
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just stayed for three nights. We had a spacious twin room at the back of the hotel. It was very clean,quiet and the beds comfortable. The reception staff were helpful; particularly the manager. There could have been more choice for breakfast. The location was ideal for us being a ten minute walk from the ferry. We purchased a 3 day ticket to enable us to visit Venice, Burano and Torchello at leisure. The Lido is the ideal place to get away from the crowds of Venice and relax. Also the prices are cheaper. We would recommend the hotel and the Lido anytime. When dining in Venice we stayed away from the tourist hot spots where prices are high.

Reviews.Title: “Is this what a room in a convent looks like?”
Reviews.Author: AnnabelleMissoula_MT
Reviews.Content: My 4 sisters & I joined a 7-country tour of Europe in May 2010. This was the hotel chosen by Insight Vacations for our 2-night stay in Venice. It is a boat ride away from Venice itself where all the action is. The boat stopped directly across the hotel. The hotel looks like a residence from the outside. Beautiful blue hydrangeas greeted us as we walked the path to the hotel's front entrance. There is a charming parlor to the left and the breakfast room to the right of the foyer is pretty. We had to walk up to our room as there was only a tiny elevator. My 1 sister and I shared a room with 2 cot-like beds; it was tiny and looked like a room in a convent. Very sparse, which was very disappointing considering the charming facade and the pretty parlor and dining room on the main floor. My 3 sisters shared a room that was big but looked like a room on a cabin loft instead of a hotel room. There was a king-size bed and a cot inside a windowless cubicle. The staff was not rude but not friendly either. Some of us even commented about this to our tour director who explained that Italians are really quite friendly "once you get to know them but not when they deal with tourists every single day." (I thought: well, the tourists are their bread & butter, so shouldn't they be trained to be more hospitable?) It took forever to get our suitcases into the rooms, so we got impatient and got them ourselves, as there was only 1 person in charge of all the luggages of our group. The dinner was so-so; however, the breakfast was outstanding. Walking around the surrounding area was very interesting. There is a beach area within a few minutes' walk. We found a restaurant a few blocks away where nobody spoke English and the menu was entirely in Italian, so ordering was at our risk. This was my second trip to Venice. On my first trip to Venice, we stayed at the Hotel Marconi which is just several minutes' walk to the Rialto Bridge. It was not as nice as Villa Mabapa; however, we didn't have to take the boat ride to where all the action was---the market, the shops, the many choices of restaurants, and all the "must-see" sites of Venice, so my friends and I were able to see more and do more in Venice than my sisters & I did because of the location of Villa Mabapa.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way, but beautiful area”
Reviews.Author: JPP566
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not near any of the typical sites in Venice people go to see and is almost 100 euros to get to by water taxi. However, the area around the hotel is beautiful and unlike other areas of Venice. There's a great beach a short ten minute walk away, and some excellent little restaurants (English speaking employees are not as easy to find in these places compared to other areas that cater more to the 'typical' tourist), you just need to walk around the area and find them on quiet, unsuspecting streets. There is also some excellent shopping in the area, with some specialty food stores. The prices also tend to be a little less expensive than in the heart of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, be aware of its location”
Reviews.Author: Charlie7fR
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel and made the mistake of not double cheking its location, the hotel is in venice but not on the main Island, it is in Lido wich is kind of the back island. Venice has like a water metro and transport is easy but the station is a 10 minutes walk. The hotel is an old big house, its forniture is old but thats its charm. Service was good, an avergae breakfast. Internet is not free, you can park you car outside. For the price and if you dont mind walking the hotel is good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethSEQ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a lovely surprise for us with a huge room and views over the lagoon to the centre of Venice. Staff went out of their way to be helpful and the breakfast was first class. This hotel is on the island of Lido which is out of the centre of Venice and away from the crowds. You can take a ferry which will stop at all the stops into Venice or you can take the ferry that is express. I believe that you can get a ticket whereupon you can get on and off the ferry and sightsee all day but this would have to be confirmed. However if you want to have some peace and quiet, nice views, pretty little beach in a boutique hotel that has a lovely restaurant and great rooms then this is for you. It is across the road from the water and they have restaurant tables inside and outside.

Reviews.Title: “How to watch the sun set in Venice...”
Reviews.Author: Robin_Saikia
Reviews.Content: I've always liked this chic little hotel on the northern end of the Venice Lido. Although it's part of Best Western it has a degree of autonomy and still conveys the impression of being a privately owned set-up, just as it was when it was founded in the high days of the 1920s. One of the great Venetian experiences is watching the sun set over Venice and the Euganean hills in the far distance. The garden restaurant and bar of the Mabapa is a superb vantage point from which to do this - the trick is to grab a bottle of prosecco and consume it on the Mabapa's private landing stage, just across the street from the hotel entrance. That done, dine in the outdoor restaurant - great set menu and impressive fish dishes a la carte.

Reviews.Title: “good base for exploring venice away from all the crowds”
Reviews.Author: elycambs
Reviews.Content: Got a v.good internet price for this hotel and very impressed as it has only recently been refurbished to a v.high standard. Lido is 20 mins by water taxi from St Mark's Square, Venice, but is also a fine destination in itself with nice restaurants, cafes, walks and views of Venice. Definitely recommended. Map provided by website not at all clear for finding the hotel - all you need to do is get off the waterbus and turn left, walking along the seafront for about ten minutes then it's on your right.

Reviews.Title: “Charming experience on Lido, albeit cold”
Reviews.Author: tigerhunt2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel VIlla Mabapa was my first ever experience of a hotel in Italy. In March 2010 I traveled to Italy for 8 days with a big school group and needless to say it was unforgettable. After an exhausting flight, we got off the vaporetto from VCE and stepped onto Lido. We walked to the hotel, very accesible to the island. The courtyard entry to Villa Mabapa showcases the true charm of the hotel. A small yet quaint restaurant served full breakfast each morning with yogurts, cereal, various pastries, coffee, juice, etc. The room my arrangement had was also very nice. There were three of us to a room and again, each one had a bed. The wood flooring was especially nice. The best part about our room was the cute courtyard that our windows opened out to. We liked it cold in our room so we opened the windows each night. One night a lonely cat jumped in the window and slept at our feet and then left at sunrise. A lovely little memory of Lido :)

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced. Tacky bunk bed style rooms. 4 star Youth Hostel maybe.”
Reviews.Author: RobWedekind
Reviews.Content: Only stay here if you get it cheap. I wanted to stay on Lido, away from the lunacy of Venice, which is 10 minutes away on the waterbus (vaporetti). Check in was ok. We got dumped in the annexe at rear of hotel, which although fairly quiet was a shockingly poorly fitted out L-shaped room. Breakfast room was horrendous. Total mess, disorganised, food also inedible, Surrounding area: don't eat at any of the restaurants on the front at Lido. You will get ripped off Â£40 or â‚¬45 per person for a lunch meal and half a bottle of wine. Go over to Venice where it's cheaper. WiFi price is a rip off. MacDonald's in over in Cannaregio, Venice next to the Ca'Doro Vaporetto boat stop is the answer for non-rip-off-priced breakfast, with (!) free WiFi. If this place is a four star, then I am Father Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Atmosphere & Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Worldtrip78
Reviews.Content: Its one of the best located Hotels of Venice with a cool, friendly atmosphere and a beautiful, romantic environment. With only a 12 minute boat ride into town and the stop not far from the hotel, we found the location and the Island excellent. The B.W. Villa Mabapa is only a nice 10 minute walk from the ferry dock which we really enjoyed walking even in November. The breakfast room of the Hotel was very romantic and typical Italian and we enjoyed the food and the variety. The Hotel itself appeared as very clean and well taken care of. Only the AC was very noisy so that we had to switch our room. The Hotel staff were ready to help us shift our room even when it was already very late at night . The Island also has a nice cafÃ©s, bar`s, restaurants and even many shopping malls. Though I have to say, I was a little dissappointed with the pizzas, but maybe that was because of high expecatations ;-) I can recommend you this hotel and the environment in Lido even in the Winter Month and for a relaxed and beautiful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about an overrated hotel”
Reviews.Author: dducheyne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 (one) week at Villa Mabapa. The rooms were outdated and in one of the showers we discovered mould. The bath rooms were not pleasant. Restaurant service was below standards and the staff seems to be untrained. One of the three reception employees was helpful, the others were arrogant or even on the brink of not to be trusted. Don't ask too much at Mabapa. The location is nice, the building has not been renovated (maybe some other rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet location!”
Reviews.Author: Tezgeo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 nights at this hotel, It is located on the Lido island, its about a 15 minute walk from the water bus stop and the main street of the lido, although it felt a bit of a walk it was actually nice to be in such a quiet location after a busy day sightseeing! The room we were in was in the building at the back, it was a nice enough room, it is not luxurious but it was comfy and clean enough! We had a balcony overlooking the garden, the bathroom was a slightly weird set up with everything apart from the shower in it then the otherside of the corridor a seperate shower (all within the room, hard to explain). In the room was a mini bar, safe and hair dryer. Hotel is set in lovely gardens with an outside bar and comfy chairs to relax in outside the front, you are right on the waters front so you have a nice view. There was no drinks menu and prices, but from the bill we got at the end it was pretty expensive at about 10euro per drink (Gin & Tonic or Whisky&Coke)! We ate in the restaurant the last night, its a really nice restaurant and a lovely menu, we were disappointed that we weren't allowed to sit outside but its a nice airy modern restaurant, we had the set menu, 4 courses of tasty, good quality food for 34 euro per person which was good! Man on reception was helpfull and friendly, and so was the barman/waiter! All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “nice place shame about the staff!”
Reviews.Author: renren1
Reviews.Content: hotel was very clean, and comfortable, close to water bus stop st nichol but good 10 min walk to nearest shopsand airport water bus and main water bus routes. we found the staff very unhelpful when asking for anything for example tea and coffee it was as it was an effort for them to give me a kettle to take to my room then to find out the milk in cartons was 2 months out of date, when we complained they just shrugged their shoulders at us and we were given more out of date milk. overall standard and cleanliness was very good but it would of been nice to have had more friendlier staff.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel restaurant was filled fresh cut flowers and the rooms were just as lovely.”
Reviews.Author: GitchyGarrons
Reviews.Content: A boat station is conveniently located across the street from the hotel. Not being use to traveling by boat I was a little intimidated, but quickly got over this fear and you can see all of Venice using this means of transportation. I had a 36 hour boat pass and my travel was unlimited.

Reviews.Title: “A 'most serene' experience”
Reviews.Author: traveller74043
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at this hotel and I found it excellent from all points of view. First and foremost its location: peaceful and yet extremely convenient (near two vaporetto stops), but far enough from the hustle and bustle of the Venice crowds. Secondly, the staff: all extremely helpful and charming; I have never received so many good pieces of information about travelling and free time in Venice. Thirdly, the rooms: extremely clean and very spacious, especially considering this is Venice. Fourthly, breakfast: great choice, great coffee, great cheese and great cakes! Thank you so much for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: PPBS
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel as we thought a 4* would be a good choice. Upon arrival it seemed we made a bad choice. Only 1 person of the staff was helpfull, all the others were not interested in the hotel guests. They don't know anything about the word 'service'. Our room was supposed to be a 'deluxe room', situated in the building behind the main building of the hotel.I have never had that type of room in my whole life ! Very disappointing if you pay 230 euro for 1 night! Breakfast was okay, but don't ask to have a table outside, as the staff is not helpfull at all, and orders you to sit inside, although it was a nice and sunny morning . Restaurant and bar staff is not trained for the job they have to do and they look like they are fed up with tourists. The location is rather good if you want to go to the beach, 3 blocks away, but beware, they charge you 18 euro for 1 sunbed. And Italy has nicer beaches than the one we visited. Conclusion : there are better hotels in and around Venice for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: sundance59
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a little out dated. The bathroom was tiny and uncomfortable. Bath towels were thin. While taking a shower a pulled a string that was hanging from the ceiling thinking it would start a fan or something. This apparently sent an alarm signal to the from desk whom decided to call and scald my husband on the phone for my mistake. This summed up the service at the hotel. The beds were suppose to be king size. We were given a room with two twin beds put together with two twin size comforters. It was very uncomfortable and felt cheap. Housekeeping walked in on us in bed one morning and she didn't realize we were still in bed whilst she continued to empty the trash etc... They never changed the sheets - we were there four nights. On a positive note, the breakfast was good and so was the location. I would recommend this hotel if you are not looking for luxury but just a decent place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor for a 4* with unhelpful staff & no private parking.”
Reviews.Author: Maggie_May09London
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we needed private parking. There is no private car park, just a small space where they cram in cars & you have to leave your keys for them to move them around, which we refused to do. The staff were not very helpful or attentive, telling us at 3 mins past 10 that the restaurant was shut & our 8 year old & us went to bed without dinner. We booked months before hand, but were stuck in the annex at the back of the hotel. The private beach is a really long walk away. Overall not really good enough for a 4* hotel. It was expensive and poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Location”
Reviews.Author: MaxWien
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet location away from the hassles of Venice. Excellent breakfast. Convenient access to ferry and vaporetto.

Reviews.Title: “Thouroughly enjoyed my stay and Villa Mabapa”
Reviews.Author: MichelleSouthLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned back from a thoroughly enjoyable short break to Venice where we stayed in the Villa Mabapa. Having read Trip adviser before hand we found a lot of relevant information missing which would certainly have been helpful to us. Firstly, the location. Lido is not a main area in Venice and may only get a small mention in the guide books. It is a delightful area with a lovely little beach with walking distance from the hotel. After arriving at Marco Polo airport you will need to get either the water taxi (private, at a rate of 95Euros) or the water bus (public transport 13 euros or 26 Euros return). The public water bus runs every hour and takes about an hour. (The private taxi is much quicker). The nearest stop to the hotel is Lido. At Lido, arrived quite late and were surprised that there were no taxis waiting around. The hotel is literally about 800 meters from the boat stop and is to the left of the stop as you come out. Although I was with my boyfriend and at no time did I at any time feel unsafe, female travellers should be aware if they are arriving late that they may need to walk to the hotel along what is a very quiet virtually isolated street. We specifically asked for a room in the pink coloured building as advised in one of the trip adviser reviews and we were not disappointed. The whole hotel was tastefully decorated and the room was to a high standard. The staff was very amiable and extremely professional. We had no complaints whatsoever. We booked on a bed and breakfast basis so canâ€™t comment on the other meals. The breakfast was continental with the usual selection for all dietary needs. No complaints! When travelling to the sights you will need to either take the water bus or water taxi. We found the waterbus ran very regularly and itâ€™s worth buying either 24 or 48 hour travel cards which are quite economic if you plan to travel a lot. Tickets can be purchased from the shop next door to the hotel or the office at the waterbus station To get to Piazzo san Marco which is one of the big touristy areas we either took the No 1 or No52 water bus which took about 10 minutes. The receptionist did inform us of a free trip that the hotel was offering to Murano which is a famous area for making Venetian glass. Unfortunately this was cancelled due to lack of demand and we didnâ€™t have enough time to go on our own. The hotel does not have bikes to rent but there is a local shop which rents on either a daily or hourly basis. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend to all our friends. The area is quiet so it might not suite youngsters wanting lively nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: happytravel09
Reviews.Content: Service was good helpful and staff were serious but polite. The room was nicely decorated and comfortable thought the temperature in the room was either too cold or too hot (recommend checking if it works properly). There is a lovely bar area and breakfast room with water views. The hotel is on Lido, a lovely island where you can see most of the Venice landmarks. By boat it takes about 25-50 mins to Venice or to Marco Polo Airport. It is much more relaxing then staying in San Marco and the ferry ride is very relaxing. Mabapa hotel is about a 10 min walk from the ferry to the hotel on the waterfront. There are a few restaurants and cafes but not really recommended for nightlife but more for a relaxing get-away. The setting of the hotel near the water was the best, the least favorite was the same breakfast every morning with not much variety if you have any special dietary requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey”
Reviews.Author: showpony
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the Villa Mabapa are charming, although prone to insect visitors. Breakfast is a decent spread. Staff a little sniffy but no real problems. My main issue is that the bikes, which are meant to be free and are almost essential if you need to get around the Lido, cost 14 euros a day during the film festival. I wouldn't have minded so much if the bike I was given had functioning brakes, lights etc. I had no brake at all on the front wheel and a pitiful excuse for one on the back. Plus, old Italian ladies have less road sense than hedgehogs so I had a couple of near disasters. Even after I asked the handyman to take a look at it, the bike was a deathtrap.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant break at the Villa Mabapa”
Reviews.Author: davidarcher
Reviews.Content: On arrival the reception staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. The room (in annexe) though basic was very clean and included all the essentials that we needed. Obviously in August the weather was hot but the air conditioning worked well. Breakfasts though continental was was well presented and of good quality. Dinner was taken in the garden area over looking the lagoon and with the added touch of a pianist and violinist playing. Food and wine choice available good (try the house wines) and excellent standard (including service). A very friendly hotel with caring staff. Well worth a visit and haven from the bustle of central Venice. C & P Phillips,Worcestershire, England

Reviews.Title: “be careful”
Reviews.Author: TexasVavava
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks good. Make sure if your breakfast is included. When I checked in, I was told that breakfast is included. But, the manager asked us to pay for the breakfast we had when we wanted to checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chaderoonie
Reviews.Content: Just back from 8 incredible days in Venice. The hotel is in a fabulous location on the Lido, great if you want to get away from the noise of Venice, however its only a 10 minute waterbus ride to St Marc's. They have recently put a new water bus stop 50 yards from the Hotel. I would suggest paying the extra and getting a superior room with balcony and garden view. These tend to be in the Pink building which is at the back. Some of the other rooms i saw were quite small and dark. Breakfast could be hit and miss. some days with fresh fruit salad etc. other days tinned fruit. Also the breakfast choice is quite limited. The hotel has a number of bikes which are free and I would recommend using them to explore the Lido.The staff are very helpful. Keep out of venice in the mornings, it's packed. we went on the beach in the mornings and then over to venice late afternoon. When I next return to venice, I will definitly come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - if you stay in the pink building...”
Reviews.Author: muffin78
Reviews.Content: Would stay here again...depending on my room. The grounds are lovely and the main building is charming. The hotel consists of various out-buildings. Ask for a room in the pink building at the front of the property. It's very nice. I was originally given a room in a building at the back of the property and it had the distinct smell of "damp" even though it looked to be freshly renovated. Steer clear of that one.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Venice”
Reviews.Author: zazni
Reviews.Content: Probably the coldest holiday we have ever had!! Decided to go hot in winter from now on but to the hotel-A bit of a walk from the ferry/bus stop for the unfit, but manageable. Found the room and ensuite a bit of a tight fit but fine if used as a base. Bed turned down every day, not sure if the floor is cleaned though-a bit of a worry as Venice is a land mine for doggy deposits!! We took advantage of the coffee making facilities but figured when we left you must have to leave cups etc outside the room because the used cups were not lifted or changed once. Staff at the reception were very helpful.Have found out that Italian food is not my thing so can't really comment on the restaurant-but there was plenty of choice at breakfast.Nice quiet hotel, but would probably go more central if heading back there.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of this one”
Reviews.Author: Chrisparmerlee
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is actually fairly decent. The staff however is another story. When we arrived the dark haired gentleman in his 40's wearing glasses informed us that our rooms were not ready but that he would upgrade us to superior rooms at their sister hotel just 200 meters away. We didn't think much of it and took the bait. So, they call their luggage guy and send us off. The other hotel was not a best western and it was on the other side of the island. If you have ever stayed on the lido I find it alot easier to stay on the port side rather than the beach side. Anyway, we get over the other hotel and decided that it simply doesn't have the charm that BW Villa Mabapa has and chose to go back and wait for our rooms to be ready. The guy was fairly aggressive in trying to get us to stay at the other hotel and made us feel uncomfortable with our decision to stay at our booked location. Magically one of the rooms were ready by the time we got back. Then, as we make our way up to store our luggage in the room that was available our other room was magically ready too. Hmm??? Starting to feel like a bait and switch. The room itself wasn't bad for venice. It was our second time staying on the Lido and knew the rooms weren't going to be out of this world. The hotel does have a nice courtyard to enjoy a glass of wine in. I wouldn't exactly call the rest of the staff very attentive either. They also said that we couldn't have the free breakfast as well unless we stayed at the other location. If we were going to venice for the beaches we would have stayed on the other side, but we were there to see the main island. Also, you should note that the hotel is a good 10-15 minute walk from the water bus. It wasn't exactly an ideal location on the lido. So, would I stay there again??? Not if you paid me to. There are far better hotels on the lido. It wasn't worth all of the hassle and feeling like we couldn't even be comfortable in our room. I do travel alot, so I'm usually pretty patient when things don't go as planned, but this was just too much.

Reviews.Title: “Holidaying on the island”
Reviews.Author: B&OSA
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a good waterfront location on the island of Lido and a lovely garden setting with a terrace under the shade of trees. Our room was comfortable, however, the shower was unusually located: in the entrance passage to the room, separate from the rest of the bathroom. We also noted that the drinks were very expensive. We enjoyed the tranquil atmosphere of the hotel and its gardens. It seemed far removed from the hussle and bussle of the main island of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very calm hotel”
Reviews.Author: ginro
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something in the center, this hotel is not for you. But if you are looking for something calm, this hotel is perfect. Not fare from the center of Venice, about 10 minutes walk from the boat and then 10 minutes of boat to get to Venice. The hotel is near of the beach. Itâ€™s a good hotel, but not a real 4 stars. The bedrrom was fine, very clean and the breakfast at the morning was good. The size of the room was in the european standard.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful,nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChristyBarcelona
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from a two night stay at Hotel Mabapa and were very pleased. It was very easy to find from the Vaperetto stop on Lido Island and from the first sight of the hotel, we were impressed. The staff were very friendly and good problem solvers. When we arrived, we discovered that we were not given two separate beds, but that they were pushed together and dressed with double bed sheets. No problem! They had the chambermaid separate the beds and dress them with new beddings while we went to dinner. The room itself was very nice. We were in the side building and we had plenty of space. I loved the big bathroom with the huge sky light! It was a very charming room. Luckly, during our stay it was sunny and we were able to enjoy the garden area for a drink in the shade. Tea and coffee is very reasonable and presented in a very lovely way. There were just two issues worth noting. One, the hotel offers a complimentary boat ride to Murano island where the glass is made and then a continuing ride to San Marco Square. They do not mention that you dock in Murano directly into a glass making factory. You can not avoid it! It was interesting but you are guided into gift shops where everything is about 5 times as much as it is outside this workshop. Do not buy anything! Also, it is really hard to find where you orginally docked to actually get the boat to San Marco square. Pay attention to where you are walking. The other issue is that they gave us incorrect information about Vaporettos to take you to the airport. We were told that they ran every hour which almost resulted in us taking a 100â‚¬ private taxi. But when we went to the vaporetto stop, the boats were going every 20 minute or so. We were wondering if the hotel had a partnership with a private taxi service. So just be aware of these two things and you will LOVE your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: phantom218
Reviews.Content: The hotel is far from the city's main drags and that is why i liked it - nice and serene and a short walk from the vaporetto. The staff was friendly and accommodating and helpful in providing information. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little Hotel - Ideal for Summer Months”
Reviews.Author: CGG180181
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for only two night in Jan 2007. The hoitel is on the Lido (the company we booked through said it was in the heart of Venice which it is not!). However, the location is lovely and allows you to see a different side to Venice and it's other islands. Although I stayed in the winter I would imagine the Lido is wonderful in the summer as it has a lovely beach area, nice shops and lots of bikes to ride around the small island. It allows you to visit the busy areas of Venice then retreat to somewhere quieter in the afternoon or evenign if you want to relax and escape the crowds. To reach the old town area of Venice you need to jump on a local water bus (you can easliy buy a 24hr, 36hr or 72hr bus pass at the airport, your hotel or at the water bus stops). This can take between 10 or 20 minutes to reach San Marco Square (main attarction) and the beginning of the grand canel. The hotel is clean and serves a lovely breakfast. The restaurant is pleasent but I would always prefer to explore and try local restaurants as they tend to always be a little nicer and more traditional. The rooms are compact but have character and a lovely balcony area. If you are staying in Venice for more than 2 days I would definitey reccommend this hotel - especially in the summer months!

Reviews.Title: “Very small”
Reviews.Author: Dboys
Reviews.Content: The hotel on the website matched what we arrived to. However, our room was not part of the main building. I think this may be a major differential between ratings. The extension rooms are so very small. We had a double room, but there was barely enough room to walk past the bed into the bathroom. Try to obtain a confirmation of room size before booking or confirm you are in the main building. Venice is notorious for its small rooms, but this was beyond a joke. Plastic fixtures also covered the place. Have stayed in much better 2 star hotels in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ginger1102
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mabapa in October 2006. The hotel is very nice. Beautiful grounds and pleasant staff. They provide an excellent breakfast with numerous options to choose from. The water buses run regularly to the main island. A tip is to use the island bus system to get to the water bus it takes less than 10 minutes and will save you a very expensive taxi ride. However you can also walk and it is only about 1Km to the hotel from the station. One other tip purchase an all day water bus ticket for 12Euros so that you can come back and forth without spending a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While the hotel offers nice and clean rooms, they are very simple and definitely not four star rating. The bar glasses were dusty, and cheap plastic ones were in the bathrooms. We made the mistake of eating dinner at their restaurant. The cover charge alone was 5 euros, and one small glass of milk was 4 euros. One evening there was no hot water as they dealt with a water supply problem. They could not fix this problem til the next day, delaying our morning plans. Getting back and forth from the Lido to Venice each day can become a hassle once the novelty wears off.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: joelajoela
Reviews.Content: The Villa Mabapa looks very nice from the outside. We had a standard room that was very small (even for European standards). The bed was tiny, a double which was pushed up against the wall. The wrost part of the room was the bad odor that eminated from the bathroom. They had a scented device plugged into the wall to mask the odor but it didn't help. Breakfast was typical for a Best Western, but I was surprised to find out that it cost 12 euros per person, per day. We did take advantage of the speed boat ride to Murano. Watch out for the hard sell that comes with the glass factory tour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, nice room, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got the room with the lagoon view which I found it very nice. The room has wood-flooring (which gave me a feeling of a beach resort) and a nice comfy bathtub. The hotel has its own garden which is also very nice and peaceful especially if you get a room that has a door opens into it. However, they were not very honest about the service they provided. Their website stated that the room rate includes free bicycyle rental and a free boat trip to Murano, however when I first arrived there and enquired about it I was told to rent one from the Lido water bus pier (a kilometre away from the hotel) and that the hotel does not own or provide any?!? The receptionist also looked annoyed when I asked - not very friendly. The next morning I enquired about it again with another receptionist just to make sure and was told that they only provide bikes during the summer months (I went there in April and the weather was very warm already)... That was such a disappointment for me because the only reason I booked a hotel in Lido was so that I could cycle around the island along the beaches. As I walked back to the pier I past Hotel Russel nearby and they had a bike rack full of bikes, regretted I didn't choose them. There was no boat trip to Murano either despite advertising that on the hotel website and the restaurant was not even open. I assume all these services are only provided during the summer months and I would appreciate it if they at least mention that on their website instead of just advertising all their fancy extra services on for the whole year. The hotel was a bit of a walk from the waterbus stop (over 1 kilometre) although there is a frequent bus service (every 20 minutes) to and from the stop the service only runs until 9pm and so if you come back from Venice late at night you would have to walk which was fine for us though.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Expatgirl07
Reviews.Content: Villa Mabapa looks great from the outside and the restaurant is nice. So, as I passing through these areas, I am thinking that I could not wait to see the room - it must be great...Wrong!!!! Very simple (basic European)...but for 215 Euros per night??? The room was nothing you want to spend any time in, so if you are looking for a nice romatic getaway, I would not recommend it. I was there on business so I can't complain too much, but I would not have been happy if I had chosen it for a nice holiday and was paying that much for a room of so little quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Villa Mabapa. No problems. Quiet, clean, friendly. Stayed in standard room. Had balcony overlooking garden area. Very nice and probably better than a view over the lagoon. Shower room separate from toilet. Double bed was two singles put together so nice and large. Matresses firm and comfortable. The free bikes are a great bonus for getting around easily - the Lido is very flat! Take the free boat trip to the glass factory. The taxi ride would normally cost Â£80. Glass works is interesting and there are some fabulous works of art. You will be asked to buy something. Its not too much sales pressure though. Note though if you are tempted by the modestly priced items you can get these cheaper elsewhere. The works of art are unique and can't be bought elsewhere. Breakfast at hotel is adequate with good scrambled eggs (or boiled by request) ham, cheese, cereals, pastries, fresh fruit etc. If you go out of high season you can use any beach it seems. The best is in front of the Excelsior where they have hot freshwater showers and lifeguards. We loved staying on the Lido - you do have to catch a water bus to go to the main islands of Venice but thats part of the holiday experience - and everyday you get to approach San Marco from the sea. We recomend this hotel. Lovely setting.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place but beware as well!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Right I dont know where to start really so i'll just put pen to paper and see how it goes ;-) We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights for our 10th anniversary and I had the following points: 1) Our room was nice and tidy but it looked like it had just been given a quick once over there where bugs splattered on the ceiling and on some of the walls. I booked a "Std" room and expected a bit more than this to be honest! 2) Don't be mislead by references to the Lagoon - it is basically the waterway between Venice and the island and not some "Blue Lagoon" type paradise I was expecting....Amazing though it is just be set in your mind re what it actually is. 3) Dont book any excursions via the reception desk - you'll find that if you ask anyone in the hotel about attractions, what to do, pricing, where the beach is they all refer you back to reception. This is for a good reason - I asked how much a Gondola ride would be and they quoted me â‚¬150 as the best deal - later on we went to the tourist office on the island and they quoted â‚¬100 for the same deal..... Once we where in venice we got the same deal for â‚¬60!!!!!!! 4) THe hotel blatantly makes alot of money from referring tourists onto other people - they will offer you a free trip to the Malono Glass factory which is definately worth a visit - but bear in mind they tell you they will collect you and drop you off there and once you have finished they will drop you off in Venice - this is C***P! They collect you and leave you stranded on the island and you need to either pay an extortionate water taxi to get back or get the water bus to get back home. 5) The hotel has a nice outside bar - use this as drinks are far cheaper than buying them on the mainland Lido or in Venice. 6) The hotel will offer you a travel card that you can buy to use on as many water bus's as you like - dont buy this its a con and much cheaper to just pay as you go. Hope that helps - re Venice all I can recommend is that you go and see the place it is absolutely awsome and rather than feeling your in another country you feel your on another planet! Waterworld! Remember Venice is VERY expensive how do these prices hit you? 1/2 pint beer and 1x can of Fanta = â‚¬10 2x Cornetto Ice Creams = â‚¬9 20 minute Water Taxi to Airport = â‚¬80

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Villa Mabapa is a beautiful Hotel, slightly off the beaten track but believe me after a day in St Mark's Square you will be relieved! The Hotel restaurant is excellent and the staff extremely gracious and welcoming - in addition the Gran Viale of the Lido is a pleasant 10 minute walk away with a good selection of restaurants that cater mostly to the local population so you don't have to worry about getting caught in Tourist Traps. The journey from the Airport by Water Taxi is effortless and by the Allilaguna Service equally easy (although a 10 minute walk from the drop off point - there are taxis and a bus service though) The great plus about this hotel is the access to the beautiful beach - making this the ideal hotel for a combined sightseeing and beach holiday. We will definitely be back to this hotel.
